Class UpwardDrawing

  • java.lang.Object
    • UpwardDrawing

  • public class UpwardDrawing
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class providing tools for computing an upward grid drawing of a directed graph that minimizes the number of crossings
    Author:
    Luca Castelli Aleardi (2019)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      DirectedGraph g
      input graph to draw
      int height
      height of the grid (input parameter)
      int width
      width of the grid (input parameter)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UpwardDrawing(DirectedGraph g, int width, int height)
      initialize the input of the program

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkValidity()
      Check whether the graph embedding is a valid upward drawing
      -) the drawing must be upward
      -) the integer coordinates of nodes must lie in the prescribed bounds: the drawing area is [0..width] x [0..height]
      -) non adjacent crossing edges must intersect at their interiors
      int computeCrossings()
      Return the number of edge crossings
      void computeUpwardDrawing()
      Main function that computes a valid upward drawing that minimizes edge crossings.
      void computeValidInitialLayout()
      Compute a valid initial layout, satisfying the prescribed requirements according to the problem definition
      Remark: the vertex coordinates are stored in the class 'Node' (Point_2 'p' attribute)
      void forceDirectedHeuristic()
      Improve the current layout by performing a local search heuristic: nodes are moved to a new location in order to reduce the number of crossings.
      static boolean hasInitialLayout(DirectedGraph graph)
      Check whether the current graph is provided with an embedding
      -) if all nodes are set to (0, 0): the graph has no embedding by definition
      -) otherwise, the graph has an embedding
      void localSearchHeuristic()
      Improve the current layout by performing a local search heuristic: nodes are moved to a new location in order to reduce the number of crossings.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • g

        public DirectedGraph g
        input graph to draw

      • height

        public int height
        height of the grid (input parameter)

      • width

        public int width
        width of the grid (input parameter)

    • Constructor Detail

      • UpwardDrawing

        public UpwardDrawing(DirectedGraph g,
                     int width,
                     int height)
        initialize the input of the program

    • Method Detail

      • computeCrossings

        public int computeCrossings()
        Return the number of edge crossings

      • checkValidity

        public boolean checkValidity()
        Check whether the graph embedding is a valid upward drawing
        -) the drawing must be upward
        -) the integer coordinates of nodes must lie in the prescribed bounds: the drawing area is [0..width] x [0..height]
        -) non adjacent crossing edges must intersect at their interiors

      • computeValidInitialLayout

        public void computeValidInitialLayout()
        Compute a valid initial layout, satisfying the prescribed requirements according to the problem definition
        Remark: the vertex coordinates are stored in the class 'Node' (Point_2 'p' attribute)

      • localSearchHeuristic

        public void localSearchHeuristic()
        Improve the current layout by performing a local search heuristic: nodes are moved to a new location in order to reduce the number of crossings. The layout must remain valid at the end.

      • forceDirectedHeuristic

        public void forceDirectedHeuristic()
        Improve the current layout by performing a local search heuristic: nodes are moved to a new location in order to reduce the number of crossings. The layout must remain valid at the end.

      • computeUpwardDrawing

        public void computeUpwardDrawing()
        Main function that computes a valid upward drawing that minimizes edge crossings.
        You are free to use and combine any algorithm/heuristic to obtain a good upward drawing.

      • hasInitialLayout

        public static boolean hasInitialLayout(DirectedGraph graph)
        Check whether the current graph is provided with an embedding
        -) if all nodes are set to (0, 0): the graph has no embedding by definition
        -) otherwise, the graph has an embedding
